comments:
This bug may be in the wrong place. Please correct me if this is so.


Procedure:

1. Create a new Flexible Java project (New->Project->Flexible Java Project)
1a. In the Flexible Project wizard, set the Name = "TestEJB"
1b. Click on the Show Advanced button (assuming that Geronimo is not the default
server)
1c. Select Geronimo V1.0 (Generic) as the Server
1d. Click on "Finish"

2. Switch to the J2EE Perspective

3. For Project TestEJB, create an EJB Module (New->J2EE EJB Module)
3a. The name of the module will be "TestEJBModule"
3b. Leave all defaults (creation of client, annotation, etc) unchanged
3c. Click on "Finish" (We don't want to change anything else).

4. Create a new EJB (In the J2EE Perspective, EJB Projects/TestEJBModule, select
New->Other->Enterprise Javabean).

PROBLEM 1: The Create Enterprise Javabean wizard only enables the selection of
Session Beans and Message Beans. There is no selection for Entity Beans!

4a. Select Session Beans as the bean type. Click on "Next".
4b. The name of the package will be "beans.ejb.test".
4c. The name of the bean will be "FacadeTestBean"
4d. Leave "Generate Annotation Support" checked
4e. Click on "Finish", because we aren't changing anything else

5. Create a new Geronimo Server (Select the "Server" tab, right click on
New->Server)
5a. Select "Geronimo V1.0 Server". Leave all else unchanged; click on "Next"
5b. In the next dialog, leave everything unchanged. Click on "Next"
5c. Add testEJBModule to the list of configured projects. Click on "Finish"

6. Start the server (Right- click on Geronimo->Start with the Server tag selected)

7. Publish the EJB (Right- click on Geronimo->Publish)

PROBLEMS:

1. The deployment of the EJB fails, with the following exception thrown:

 Server reports: Remote interface class not found: beans.ejb.test.FacadeTest

2. The client code fails to compile. All references to javax.ejb are unresolved.

3. It appears that the necessary interfaces (Home, Remote) are mising from the
EJB module.

4. Furthermore, there appears to be no way to generate the necessary stub code
(right- 
clicking on the various projects and files only invokes a validator, nothing else).

Apparently there are many things missing in the handling of EJBs with this tool.
For 
this reason, the Geronimo and other plugins are unusable for EJB development.

Support for Geronimo EJBs within WTP, while very reasonable, is not available
yet.  Marking this bug as an enhancement request, rather than a defect.
This defect can be marked as RESOLVED or INVALID.

(In reply to comment #2)
> This defect can be marked as RESOLVED or INVALID.
 
I do not understand. Has someone added the appropriate functionalituy after all this time, or are you just requesting that I or someone else just get rid of it?

Please advise.
Assign the bug to Sachin (as it's his code now)
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
